name: Interface Connector.IntegerArgument
text:
Specification for and value of a Connector argument,
 whose value is an integer.  Integer values are represented
 by their corresponding strings.
codes:
public static interface Connector.IntegerArgument
extends Connector.Argument

methods.description:
Sets the value of the argument.
 The value should be checked with isValid(int)
 before setting it; invalid values will throw an exception
 when the connection is established - for example,
 on LaunchingConnector.launch(java.util.Map<java.lang.String, ? extends com.sun.jdi.connect.Connector.Argument>)
Performs basic sanity check of argument.
Performs basic sanity check of argument.

Return the string representation of the value
 parameter.
 Does not set or examine the current value of this
 instance.

Return the value of the argument as a int.  Since
 the argument may not have been set or may have an invalid
 value isValid(String) should be called on
 Connector.Argument.value() to check its validity.  If it is invalid
 the int returned by this method is undefined.
The upper bound for the value.
The lower bound for the value.
